de.ovgu.softwareprojekt.networking

Class AbstractPsychicServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.ovgu.softwareprojekt.networking.AbstractPsychicServer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ButtonListener, ClientListener, ResetListener, OnCommandListener, ExceptionListener, ClientLossListener
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    GraphingServer, KukaServer, MouseServer, NesServer, PsychicServer

    public abstract class AbstractPsychicServer
extends java.lang.Object
implements OnCommandListener, ClientListener, ExceptionListener, ButtonListener, ResetListener, ClientLossListener
    This class encapsulates the whole server system:

    1. A DiscoveryServer used to make clients able to find this server
    2. A CommandConnection to be able to reliable communicate about important stuff, like enabling sensors
    3. A DataConnection to rapidly transmit sensor data

    • Field Detail

      • mDiscoveryServer

        private DiscoveryServer mDiscoveryServer
        AbstractPsychicServer handling responding to discovery broadcasts

      • mCurrentUnboundClientConnection

        private ClientConnection mCurrentUnboundClientConnection
        This is the latest unbound client connection, which makes it also the currently advertised connection. When bound, this instance will be moved to mClientManager, and a new instance will be set instead

      • mDiscoveryPort

        port where discovery packets are expected

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractPsychicServer

        public AbstractPsychicServer(@Nullable
                             java.lang.String serverName,
                             int discoveryPort)
        Create a new server. It will be offline (not using any sockets) until start() is called.
        Parameters:
        serverName - if not null, this name will be used. otherwise, the devices hostname is used
        discoveryPort - the port that should be listened on for new devices

      • AbstractPsychicServer

        public AbstractPsychicServer(java.lang.String serverName)
        Create a new server. It will be offline (not using any sockets) until start() is called. The discovery port is defaulted to port 8888
        Parameters:
        serverName - the name this server will be discoverable as

      • AbstractPsychicServer

        public AbstractPsychicServer(int discoveryPort)
        Create a new server. It will be offline (not using any sockets) until start() is called. The device hostname will be used as server name.
        Parameters:
        discoveryPort - the discovery port to use

      • AbstractPsychicServer

        public AbstractPsychicServer()
        Create a new server. It will be offline (not using any sockets) until start() is called. Port 8888 will be used as the discovery port, and the device hostname will be used as server name.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()
           throws java.io.IOException
        Starts the server. This will start making the server available for discovery, and also block the command and data sockets.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if one of the connections could not be initialised

      • close

        public void close()
        Stop listening on all ports and free them.

      • getHostName

        private java.lang.String getHostName()
        Tries to get a server name via the host name; not very reliable, but also not very important.
        Returns:
        the host name of this device, or, if it is not known, "unknown hostname"

      • onCommand

        public final void onCommand(java.net.InetAddress origin,
                            AbstractCommand command)
        Called whenever a command packet has arrived
        Specified by:
        onCommand in interface OnCommandListener
        Parameters:
        origin - host of the sender
        command - the command issued

      • onClientLoss

        public final void onClientLoss()
        Called when the client manager detects a client loss. Used to re-check whether the server must be advertised again. This function is not to be used out of AbstractPsychicServer or modified.
        Specified by:
        onClientLoss in interface ClientLossListener

      • advertiseServer

        private void advertiseServer()
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Initialising the discovery server makes it possible for the client ot find use. The command- and data connection need to be initialised, because they provide important information
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if no new ClientConnection could be initialized

      • disconnectClient

        public boolean disconnectClient(NetworkDevice client)
                         throws java.io.IOException
        Closes the clients handler, and notifies the client of his disconnection
        Parameters:
        client - the client to be removed
        Returns:
        false if client could not be found, true otherwise
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the client could not receive the disconnect signal

      • registerDataSink

        public void registerDataSink(NetworkDataSink dataSink,
                             SensorType requestedSensor)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Register a new data sink to be included in the data stream
        Parameters:
        dataSink - where new data from the sensor should go
        requestedSensor - which sensors events are relevant
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if a client could not be notified of the sensor change

      • registerDataSink

        public void registerDataSink(NetworkDataSink dataSink,
                             NetworkDevice origin,
                             SensorType requestedSensor)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Register a new data sink to be included in the data stream. Only data from a single client and sensor will arrive.
        Parameters:
        dataSink - where new data from the sensor should go
        origin - the network device which is allowed to send to this sink
        requestedSensor - which sensor events are relevant
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if a client could not be notified of the sensor change

      • unregisterDataSink

        public void unregisterDataSink(NetworkDataSink dataSink)
                        throws java.io.IOException
        Unregister a data sink from all sensors
        Parameters:
        dataSink - which data sink to remove
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if a client could not be notified of a no longer required sensor

      • unregisterDataSink

        public void unregisterDataSink(NetworkDataSink dataSink,
                               SensorType sensor)
                        throws java.io.IOException
        Unregister a data sink from a single sensor
        Parameters:
        dataSink - which data sink to remove
        sensor - the sensor for which the data sink was registered
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if a client could not be notified of a no longer required sensor

      • addButton

        public void addButton(java.lang.String name,
                      int id)
               throws java.io.IOException
        Add a button to be displayed on the clients. All buttons will be displayed with the same size in a vertical LinearLayout ordered by their ID. setButtonLayout(String) can be used to display custom layouts.
        Parameters:
        name - text to be displayed on the button
        id - id of the button. ids below zero are reserved.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if a client could not be notified of newly required button

      • clearButtons

        public void clearButtons()
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Removes all buttons added to the app using either addButton(String, int) or setButtonLayout(String).
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if a client could not be notified of a no longer required button

      • removeButton

        public void removeButton(int id)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Removes a button from the clients. Only supports buttons added with addButton(String, int).
        Parameters:
        id - id of the button
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if a client could not be notified of a no longer required button

      • setButtonLayout

        public void setButtonLayout(@Nullable
                            java.lang.String xml)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Sets a button layout to be displayed on all clients
        Parameters:
        xml - valid android XML layout using only LinearLayout and Button. if string is null ButtonMap will be used
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if a client could not be notified of the new button layout

      • setSensorSpeed

        public void setSensorSpeed(SensorType sensor,
                           SetSensorSpeed.SensorSpeed speed)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Change the speed of a sensor. The default speed is the SENSOR_DELAY_GAME speed.
        Parameters:
        sensor - the sensor to change
        speed - the speed to use for sensor
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if a client could not be notified of the changed sensor speed

      • getSensorMaximumRange

        public float getSensorMaximumRange(SensorType sensor,
                                   NetworkDevice device)
        Retrieve the sensor range of a sensor on a specified device
        Parameters:
        sensor - the range of this sensor will be returned
        device - the sensor on this device will be returned
        Returns:
        the sensors maximum range as reported by android

      • getSensorMaximumRange

        public java.util.HashMap<NetworkDevice,java.lang.Float> getSensorMaximumRange(SensorType sensor)
        Retrieve the sensor range of a sensor on all connected devices
        Parameters:
        sensor - the sensor of which the maximum range is required
        Returns:
        a mapping from NetworkDevice to the float range

      • displayNotification

        public void displayNotification(int id,
                                java.lang.String title,
                                java.lang.String content,
                                NetworkDevice device)
                         throws java.io.IOException
        this method sends a notification to the device which is then displayed
        Parameters:
        id - NotificationID: should start at 0 and increases with each new notification while device is connected. Has to be unique.
        title - - title of the notification
        content - - content of the notification
        device - - device that shall display the notification
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if a client could not be notified of the notification that should be displayed

      • displayNotification

        public void displayNotification(int id,
                                java.lang.String title,
                                java.lang.String content)
                         throws java.io.IOException
        Send a notification to all known devices
        Parameters:
        id - NotificationID: should start at 0 and increases with each new notification while device is connected. Has to be unique.
        title - the notification title
        content - the notification content
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if a device could not be requested to display the notification

      • setClientMaximum

        public void setClientMaximum(int maximum)
        Set the maximum number of clients that may be accepted. If this number is reached, the server will no longer advertise the server.
        Parameters:
        maximum - maximum number of clients

      • getClientMaximum

        public int getClientMaximum()
        Return the current client maximum
        Returns:
        current maximum client count

      • removeClientMaximum

        public void removeClientMaximum()
        Removes the restriction on client numbers

      • hideResetButton

        public void hideResetButton(boolean hide)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Hide the reset button on all clients
        Parameters:
        hide - true if the button should be hidden
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - is thrown if command could not be sent

      • isClientMaximumReached

        private boolean isClientMaximumReached()
        Check for the maximum number of clients
        Returns:
        true if no further clients may connect

                                  java.lang.String description)
                           throws java.io.IOException
        sends a description for the sensortype
        Parameters:
        type - affected sensor
        description - description for the affected sensor
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the sensor description could not be sent
